revised_title: The Reflex Function of the Medulla Oblongata and Spinalis: The Principle of Tone in the Muscular System
tldr: Marshall Hall investigates the reflex function of the medulla oblongata and spinalis, discovering that it plays a crucial role in muscular system tone. He also demonstrates that this reflex function can be influenced by substances like opium and strychnine and can be disrupted by toxins like hydrocyanic acid.
